meanings.definition: Avoidance of activity or exertion; laziness.
meanings.sent1: Her indolence prevented her from completing her chores on time.
meanings.sent2: His indolence was evident in his reluctance to get out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat's indolence was comical as it refused to chase after the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The indolence of the stagnant water mirrored his lack of motivation to make changes in his life.
meanings.sent5: The indolence of the sloth hanging lazily from the tree branch was a sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The student's indolence led to poor academic performance.
meanings.sent2: The indolence of the employee was a cause of concern for the company.
meanings.sent3: Despite his indolence, he somehow managed to finish the project just in time.
meanings.sent4: The indolence of the old clock was a reminder of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: Her indolence was like a heavy weight dragging her down from reaching her full potential.
